responses.response:

- "Had" is a modal auxiliary verb used to form the past perfect tense, and it is followed by the past participle of the main verb. In this case, the past participle of "open" is "opened."
- "In" is not necessary in this sentence, as it does not complete a verbal phrase.

In summary:
- The phrase "should had been" was corrected to "should have been."
- The past participle of the main verb "open" was changed from "had been" to "been."
- No additional "in" was added to the sentence.
responses.expected_output:
- "Opened" is the correct spelling of "oppened."
- "Have" replaces "had."
question_values: The restaurant should had been oppened when I came out , but it was closed because of the hour the show finished .
The restaurant should have been opened when I came out , but it was closed because of the hour the show finished .
